article.headline: Old Dominion 69, William &amp, Mary 53
article.story: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. -- Frank Hassell scored 21 points and grabbed 11 rebounds and Kent Bazemore added 14 points and 12 rebounds to lead Old Dominion over William & Mary 69-53 on Wednesday night. The Monarchs (19-6, 10-4 Colonial Athletic Association) led 33-25 at halftime after shooting 46.4 percent from the floor (13 of 28) in the opening half. Old Dominion started the second half on a 21-7 run, taking its largest lead, 54-32, with 9:37 left to play. Marquel De Lancey added 12 points for the Monarchs, who outscored the Tribe 42-10 in the paint, posted a 44-21 rebounding advantage and scored 21 second-chance points to none. Julian Boatner scored 15 points for the Tribe (7-18, 3-11), who shot 38.6 percent from the field (17 of 44). Brandon Britt and Quinn McDowell added 13 apiece. The Monarchs have won five of six and William & Mary has dropped six of seven.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
